events.message: The insured reported an auto accident involving their vehicle where it was rear-ended at a stoplight.
The claim was categorised as an auto accident based on the description of the collision and involved vehicle details.
An agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and begin communication with the policyholder.
The insured received an acknowledgement of their claim submission and next steps were outlined clearly.
The insurance company requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates for the claim.
The policyholder submitted all requested documents including detailed images of the accident damage and the police report.
The investigation into the auto accident claim began to verify the facts and assess the damage causation and coverage.
The investigation was completed confirming the vehicle collision details and validating the coverage under the policy.
A settlement amount was proposed based on damage estimates and policy limits to resolve the auto accident claim.
The insured provided positive feedback on the claim handling process and expressed satisfaction with the communication.
The claim approval was finalized confirming coverage and authorizing payment in accordance with the proposed settlement.
Payment for the approved auto accident claim was issued promptly to the policyholder's designated account.
The claim has been officially closed after successful resolution and payment, with all documentation finalized.
The auto accident claim file was archived in the system for future reference and compliance record keeping.
